messages.content: What is the main purpose of the Federation of Social Protection, Work and Employment?
The Federation of Social Protection, Work and Employment serves as a trade union for civil servants who work in social services and employment sectors, advocating for their rights and interests.

metadata.title: Federation of Social Protection, Work and Employment

messages.content: How did the Federation of Social Protection, Work and Employment come into existence?
The Federation of Social Protection, Work and Employment was established through the merger of two organizations: the Federation of Labour Ministry Employees and the Federation of Social Security.

metadata.title: Federation of Social Protection, Work and Employment

messages.content: What affiliation does the Federation of Social Protection, Work and Employment have, and what was its membership size reported in 1995?
The federation is affiliated with the French Democratic Confederation of Labour and reported having 16,000 members by 1995.

metadata.title: French Confederation of Management – General Confederation of Executives

messages.content: What is the primary focus of the French Confederation of Management – General Confederation of Executives?
The confederation primarily organizes unions for professional employees, specifically those in higher education and management or executive positions.

metadata.title: French Confederation of Management – General Confederation of Executives

messages.content: Can you describe the historical background of the French Confederation of Management?
The confederation originated in 1945 from several former unions of engineers, marking its establishment in the post-World War II era.

metadata.title: French Confederation of Management – General Confederation of Executives

messages.content: What has been the trend in the CFE-CGC's voting results in professional elections?
The CFE-CGC saw an increase in its voting results, achieving 7.01% in the 2002 elections and improving to 8.19% in 2008, which was its best performance to date.

metadata.title: French Confederation of Management – General Confederation of Executives

messages.content: Who is the current leader of the French Confederation of Management, and when did they take office?
The current leader is François Hommeril, who took office in 2016.

metadata.title: French Confederation of Management – General Confederation of Executives

messages.content: What types of federations and unions are affiliated with the CFE-CGC?

The CFE-CGC has a diverse range of affiliates, including federations for the food industry, water and sanitation, insurance, chemistry, public services, and several others related to various sectors like transport, media, and metallurgy.
What are the main ethnic groups in Al-Hasakah, and how has the population changed over time?

Al-Hasakah is predominantly populated by Arabs, along with significant numbers of Kurds and Assyrians. There are also smaller communities of Armenians and Chechens. The population has evolved, with reported figures showing a growth from 7,835 inhabitants in 1942 to an estimated 422,445 in 2023.
Describe the historical significance of Al-Hasakah and its archaeological findings.

Al-Hasakah has a rich historical background, with evidence of ancient cities like Qirdahat and Magarisu. Excavations have revealed materials from the Middle-Assyrian, Byzantine, and Islamic eras, indicating its importance over centuries. The last period of occupation ended in the 15th century, showcasing a 1,500-year gap between significant historical phases.
How did the civil war impact the control of Al-Hasakah?

During the civil war, Al-Hasakah saw a shift in control, especially after the Battle of Hasakah in 2015, where the Kurdish YPG gained significant territory from the Syrian government. By August 2016, the Kurdish forces controlled about 95% of the city, establishing it as part of the autonomous Federation of Northern Syria – Rojava.
What are the main climatic characteristics of Al-Hasakah?
Al-Hasakah has a Mediterranean-influenced semi-arid climate, characterized by very hot, dry summers and cool, wet winters, which can experience occasional frosty nights.
What role do religious institutions play in Al-Hasakah?

Religious institutions in Al-Hasakah include over forty mosques and at least nine churches, serving a diverse population. The Cathedral of the Assumption of Mary is significant as the episcopal see for the Syriac Catholic Archeparchy, emphasizing the city's religious diversity.
What events led to the establishment of Al-Hasakah as a town in the 20th century?

Al-Hasakah was established as a town in April 1922 when it became a French military post. This was part of a broader strategy by the French Mandate authorities, responding to the need for new settlements after the establishment of Turkey and the influx of refugees following the Armenian and Assyrian genocides.
Can you explain the significance of the Hasakah Security Box in the city?

The Hasakah Security Box is a Syrian government enclave established in August 2016 within Al-Hasakah. It includes key government facilities such as a prison and police headquarters. After significant territorial losses to Kurdish forces, it represents the limited control the Syrian government maintains in the city.
How has the demographic composition of Al-Hasakah changed since the 1930s?

In the 1930s, Al-Hasakah was primarily populated by Arabs, with a growing Kurdish presence. By 1992, it was characterized as an Arab city with an increasingly significant Kurdish population, reflecting ongoing demographic changes over the decades.
